issues.description: The problem statement contains conflicting information regarding the type of the 'orders' attribute in the `SealSaloon` class. Line 70 specifies it as a `List<Meal>`, while line 85 refers to it as an 'array of orders'. The solution implements it as a `Meal[]` (an array), which aligns with the 'array of orders' description and the provided `ArrayHelpers` class.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement to consistently specify the type of the `orders` attribute as an array (e.g., `Meal[]` or 'array of Meal objects') to avoid confusion.

issues.description: The problem statement and its accompanying UML diagram explicitly define the 'orders' attribute in the 'SealSaloon' class as a 'List<Meal>'. However, the provided solution implements this attribute as a 'Meal[]' (an array). This discrepancy in the specified collection type for the same conceptual entity can confuse students, as they might attempt to use `java.util.List` methods which are incompatible with arrays, or struggle to understand the intended use of the provided `ArrayHelpers` in conjunction with the `List` requirement.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement (both the text description and the UML diagram) to specify the 'orders' attribute as a 'Meal[]' (an array) instead of 'List<Meal>'. This will align the requirements with the provided `ArrayHelpers` utility class and the structure of the reference solution.
